channel.title: Is this a gaming computer?
channel.description:
case - Y, really nice monitor - Y, 22" acer PSU - X CPU - Y, i7 920 Motherboard X Video Card X RAM - X Keyboard- Y, new G11 Mouse - Y, G5 Hard Drive Y, 500GB seagate DVD - NOT NEEDED Floppy - NOT NEEDED
This what I have so far. My dad picked up an i7 920 the other day :) I'll get it in a few days when I see him...
I'm just thinking... what kind of ram and video card should I get and how much of it? I plan to do intense stuff on this computer.
Oh and the motherboard is a question as well. The cheapest i7 mobos are 300 bucks and most expensive 550 USD... Is there really any difference? I know triple channel ram is pointless.
I'll probably get a card reader for the 5.25" bay.

Vista x64 installed, it recognizes my 6gb ram. I’ll get some pictures/video done tomorrow or something.

item.title: Is this a gaming computer?
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

I’m holding the CPU in my hand right now. Awesome.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 10, 2009, 06:02:57 pm[/size][hr]I’m trying to decide on a mobo, i’ve got 3 main choices:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813188039 (personal fav because good rep company)

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813128362 (gigabyte, which I don’t trust after first mobo I ever had died within 3 months)

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813131346 (asus, looks too stock)

Any professionals?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a gaming computer?
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“boriz, post:9, topic:255236”]Ah, quite yes.

Gonna pick up my processor tomorrow. Sweet.[/quote]

Also, do you have a budget? I’m guessing you don’t.

The PSU will depend on the GPU, and if you do get the GTX295 that xEnt mentioned, you will probably need a 700ish watt PSU.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this a gaming computer?
item.dc:creator: @boriz boriz
item.description:
@boriz wrote:

I believe a piece of software like “gamestreamer” will do just that.

[quote=“xEnt, post:2, topic:255236”][quote author=boriz link=topic=337280.msg2619121#msg2619121 date=1231261462]
case - Y, really nice
monitor - Y, 22" acer
PSU - X
CPU - Y, i7 920
Motherboard X
Video Card X
RAM - X
Keyboard- Y, new G11
Mouse - Y, G5
Hard Drive Y, 500GB seagate
DVD - NOT NEEDED
Floppy - NOT NEEDED

This what I have so far. My dad picked up an i7 920 the other day
I’ll get it in a few days when I see him…

I’m just thinking… what kind of ram and video card should I get and how much of it? I plan to do intense stuff on this computer.

Oh and the motherboard is a question as well. The cheapest i7 mobos are 300 bucks and most expensive 550 USD…
Is there really any difference? I know triple channel ram is pointless.

I’ll probably get a card reader for the 5.25" bay.
[/quote]If your going to buy an i7, why not buy triple channel, a 3gb kit will do fine. As for video card it all depends how much money your willing to spend, but in the high end range the best bang for the buck right now is the GTX 260+, if you just want the best of the best, wait 1 month and buy the GTX295 for 500$ USD.[/quote]

I just know that tom’s said that triple channel gives you about 3% increase in speed, which is NOTHING and not worth the extra money. I’ll buy a 3 x 2GB kit instead with that.

Read full topic
